results.title: Operations Assistant
results.description:
Location: Remote, Canada

About Girlboss:

Girlboss is a community of ambitious women and your navigator for the future of work. We’re here to spark the thrill of possibility, to inspire and inform, so that you can find success on your terms.

As a modern media brand, Girlboss creates engaging, resonant content for our audience of 2M+ across multiple channels. These include our website, where we post long-reads, how-tos and profiles, and Girlboss Daily, our must-read morning newsletter. Girlboss Radio is our iconic podcast, which brings listeners career advice they can actually use, via conversations between new host, Avery Francis, and an impressive roster of guests. We also engage our community through Girlboss Goods, a marketplace of products by women-founded small businesses as well and Girlboss Jobs, a job board of dream postings to help our community level up.

We believe in transparency and feedback, taking extreme ownership, being positive problem solvers, infinite learners, under-promising and over-delivering and having fun along the way.

Girlboss is powered by a small and mighty fully remote global team.

The Opportunity:

Girlboss is looking for a reliable and detail oriented Operations Assistant to join our fully remote team. If you’re looking to leverage your business background to make a big difference in a small team, this is the place for you.

You love processes and optimizing every part of your life. You are a doer and have a proven track record of operational excellence and results. You are detail oriented and love to keep things organized and are most at home ensuring whatever needs to get done gets done consistently. You’re highly analytical and are comfortable with contracts, excel models and the finance & accounting function. Most importantly — you are a humble, loyal, and a value driven individual.

In this role, you will wear multiple hats and assist in the day-to-day operations of the business as well as support key growth initiatives.

Responsibilities Include:

  • Ensure overall integrity of data and accuracy: overall data clean up, compliance & maintenance.
  • Assist with the forecasting & budgeting process.
  • Assist with payroll and month end oversight with bookkeepers.
  • Conduct tax filings & AR management.
  • Oversight of inventory & fulfillment.
  • Support sales operations processes.
  • Provide ad hoc cross functional support and assist with business operations and growth.
  • Legal & ESOP support
  • Assist with general administrative & customer service tasks as needed.

Requirements

  • Business/analytics degree or equivalent.
  • Accounting experience and/or background and/or experience working in the finance and operations function of a startup is a strong asset.
  • Strong work ethic - hard worker who maintains high standards.
  • Meticulous with details and incredibly organized.
  • Humble & dependable, with a positive attitude.
  • Flexible and comfortable wearing multiple hats.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, fully remote environment.
  • Demonstrate a high degree of confidentiality with professionalism, tact and diplomacy.
  • Embodies our core values and can drive our mission forward with integrity.

Benefits

Home Office & Productivity

  • Flexible remote culture with opportunity for asynchronous operations with the ability to work in the time zone of your choice, anywhere in the world
  • Generous stipend to help create your perfect work from anywhere setup
  • Support for training & conferences
  • Enthusiastic encouragement of power naps & breaks during the work day
  • Audible coverage

Culture & Community

  • Monthly team activities (Lunch & Learns, AMAs, Socials and Book Club)
  • Birthday, Anniversary, Life Celebrations - we’ll celebrate your milestones. You’ll also get the day off on your birthday.
  • Quarterly In-person team socials
  • 3 additional paid days off per year to volunteer for a cause of your choosing
  • Annual company-wide retreat and holiday party
  • Lots of fun free merch
  • 5-week sabbatical after 4 years on staff

Health & Wellness

  • Comprehensive medical and dental benefits
  • Unlimited sick days (we support menstrual leave as well!)
  • 5 annual personal days
  • Annual team holiday shutdown (paid, fully offline between Christmas and New Years)

*Benefits may vary depending on the geographical location where you work.

Girlboss is an equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination based on legally protected classes in accordance with applicable federal, provincial and local laws including ethnic origin, religion/belief, disability, age, sexual orientation and gender identity/gender expression. For any accessibility-related assistance, please share in your application.

We thank you for considering this opportunity and thank everyone who took the time to apply. Please note that due to the high level of applicants only successful applicants will be notified. We appreciate your patience as we review all applications.

results.title: Business Analyst
results.description:
About us

Viable Data is an innovative technology, data and UX consultancy, delivering excellence through our projects and providing our people with a supportive culture and opportunities for growth and continuous learning.

We thrive on the challenge of working across different projects, user needs and technologies and our teams and people live this every day. Our people-first approach and culture is central to our growing success as a consultancy.

We are an all-inclusive equal opportunities employer and proudly celebrate diversity. If you thrive on challenge, have a passion to learn and make a difference, and enjoy being part of a growing multidisciplinary team, look no further and start your Viable career, now.

 

About the role

As a Business Analyst at Viable Data, you will be someone who can adapt quickly and easily to the flexible needs of our Central Government customers. You will join one of our high-performing consulting teams where you will play a pivotal role in designing & delivering exceptional digital products and services that directly contribute to the delivery of UK policy, economic growth and security.

 

This role is largely remote with occassional business essential travel.

Requirements

Key responsibilities

  • Supporting and driving the development of a range of digital products, using Agile methodologies, and preparing and refining user stories.
  • Investigate, analyse, visualise, articulate, and solve complex business problems and concepts.
  • Business analysis and modelling.
  • Leading Business Process Modelling (using BPMN tools).
  • Working with a range of stakeholders to understand the relative priorities and manage product roadmaps.
  • Stakeholder relationship management.
  • Create business documentation for reference and to support user training.

Skills and experience needed

  • Excellent written and verbal communication abilities - presenting findings and related design/business recommendations and insights clearly that stakeholders can understand and use. Able to communicate with stakeholders at all levels.
  • Proven analysis skills - experience of various business analysis methods (particularly Business Process Modelling), both qualitative and quantitative, understanding of how and when to apply them appropriately.
  • People skills – empathetic, great listener and have a natural curiosity to understand people, their motivations and thought processes.
  • Experience and understanding of a range of User Centred Design practices
  • Organisation, time management and collaboration skills.

 

Due to the nature of work, you must be willing to undergo and be capable of achieving SC security clearance

Benefits

Why work with us?

As well as providing a great place to work that has an amazing culture and the opportunity to work on excellent projects where you will really make a difference, we have a whole host of additional employee benefits.

Our benefits package includes:

  • 25 days leave
  • 5 days dedicated training allowance, with individual budget
  • Mentoring system, with 6-month review cycles
  • Flexible hours and supportive of remote working
  • 5% pension company contributions
  • Annual bonus based on company performance
  • Choice of company laptop (Macbook, Windows)

Requirements

results.title: EDI Business Analyst – Healthcare
results.description:
Company Description

The U.S. healthcare sector is complex and dynamic - a vast and diverse network of entities that impacts the population and economy like no other. At USD$4.1 trillion, healthcare spending represents nearly 18% of U.S. GDP.  Despite clear changes in available resources, health service buying, selling, and settlements have seen little change in the past decade.

MacroHealth is a company you will be proud to be part of. As a future Macro-mate, you will help us achieve our mission to disrupt the U.S. health sector by building the most advanced and trusted market platform for health service payers and providers. 

At MacroHealth, we are creating intelligent Health Markets by building technology, knowledge, and relationships that enable payers and providers to optimize the buying and selling of health services. 

We offer our team members an inclusive and supportive environment where we help each other to grow as an individual and as a team. 



Job Description

MacroHealth is looking for an experienced and enthusiastic EDI Business Analyst to join our Implementations team. You will be part of a smart and collaborative Implementation team and stand as an essential component between MacroHealth, the Payers, and Provider networks, to drive exceptional customer experience during the implementation phase. 

You will also work closely with members of the Customer Success, Sales, and Development team and will receive support from a world-renowned leadership team with a track record of leading the development of multiple successful companies and products. If you have a customer-first mindset and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you!

What You Will Do

  • Gather functional requirements including workflows, use cases, business rules and documents them in a structured manner  
  • Support design, build and test planning phases for medium to large scope enhancements and projects
  • Record and communicate issues and related details to internal and external stakeholders accurately and in a timely manner
  • Configure based on requirements and business rules for new/existing implementations  
  • Analyze, research, manage, and resolve functional (and other) inquiries received from customers during implementation project
  • Develop test plans, test cases, test scenarios and test reports on multiple projects
  • Facilitate testing meetings and communicate test progress status and results and other relevant information to project stakeholders and the management team 
  • Research pass and fail results and participate in defective meetings; providing information required to triage and resolve issues encountered during testing
  • Develop and incorporate organizational best practices into implementation processes    
  • Work independently and within a collaborative team environment with minimum supervision
  • Participate in creating new processes and templates as well as updating internal documentation and processes as needed
  • Perform root cause analysis, including corrective action planning and documentation to support analysis         



Qualifications
  • Bachelor's Degree in a related field
  • 3-5 years' experience working in a US Healthcare Payer environment and in a client facing client-facing capacity
  • Well versed with the layout of HIPAA X12 EDI data exchanges
  • Experience in writing and analyzing business and system requirement documents that convey complex business analysis and technology solutions
  • In depth experience in Microsoft suites, including Word, Excel, Visio, Power Point, and SharePoint
  • Comfortable working on complex solutions, products and customer programs 
  • Self-starter with the ability to take ownership, work with tight timelines, and handle various tasks simultaneously
  • Excellent oral, written documentation, and presentation skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Ability to travel up to 25% of the time within North America (when travel restrictions are lifted)

Bonus Point if You Have the Following:

  • Experience with SaaS software testing strategies, conditions, and evaluation of expected results
  • Hands on experience in JIRA or similar tools
  • Sound understanding of basic views of JSON, delimited and XML files and general database concepts



Additional Information

More about us

MacroHealth is a highly collaborative work environment where each team member can rely on the skills, expertise, and support of one another across the company. We operate with an open-door policy and are wide open to new perspectives for improving our operations and fueling future growth with a diverse and engaged team.  

We offer

  • Remote-friendly work environment 
  • Flexible PTO with no annual upper cap 
  • Extended parental leave  
  • Equity awards 
  • Extended medical, dental and vision plan for employee and dependents 
  • 401(k) contributions matching

How we protect team member health and safety 

At MacroHealth we recognize the impacts of the global pandemic have taken shape differently for each of us based on our role, our location, our family situations, and job transitions. Health, safety and wellbeing are top of mind for us in supporting safe office environments as well as engaging team members working from home. As part of this approach, a vaccination policy has been implemented requiring all eligible employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to work in one of our offices or travel to client locations. 

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion 

We are committed to facilitating constructive team member engagement and promoting a respectful work environment. We design our company processes to surface necessary conversations, engage multiple voices, remove barriers, and recognize contributions made at every level. We actively promote practices to create lasting change and partner with organizations that align with our values.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

This role requires legal authorization to work in US 

 

MacroHealth is an equal opportunity employer.

results.title: Business Analyst
results.description:
Start with Data is the leading product data management consultancy in the UK. We help our customers create long-lasting value from better product data management. Offering expert industry knowledge retailers, brands and manufacturers use Start with Data for Product Information Management (PIM) & Master Data Management (MDM) strategy, implementation, and product content services.

 

Companies such as Pets at Home, Currys, Barbour, and RS Components trust Start with Data to ensure their product data meets the needs of their customers. Ask our customers and they will tell you the main thing that differentiates Start with Data is our people. PIM is our purpose, and our strong set of values underpin how our employees & associates deliver such a great experience for all our customers.

 

We are looking for bright, talented, and driven people to come and join us on our journey.

 

You can read about some of our methodology and insights on our website.

 

About this role

Our Business Analysts work with our larger PIM and MDM implementation projects, with our retail, distributor and brand clients. These projects usually involve a large programme of digital and data transformation, across the product life cycle. Our business analysts are experts in process design and requirements capture, working closely with our client stakeholders and SMEs. Business Analysts often support the functional build of our PIM and MDM solutions during the build phase in a requirements and QA capacity. They also ensure quality, complete and consistent product data is at the foundation of each engagement.

 

Working under the leadership of a Lead Business Consultant, they support the definition, documentation and delivery of business requirements during our client PIM solution discovery, design and in conjunction with our Centre of Excellence, Data and Solution Architects to coordinate the delivery of the technology solution to meet the client's needs. Generally, these technology platforms will be one or many of the several software platforms we implement.

What we expect from you...

  • Run client-facing workshops to facilitate business process and data requirements definition.

  • Analyse large, as-is complex business processes and business architectures across the product lifecycle

  • Document target business processes & workflows

  • Consult and work with solution delivery teams to ensure solutions meet business requirements

  • Train client SMEs on new solution

 
You must have:

  • Worked either in consulting or on the clients side on one or more retail, brand, manufacturer or distributor data-related projects, ideally around the product data space - for example, eCommerce, Digital, ERP, supply chain, DAM, PLM or product & supplier management.

  • Been a business analyst on one or more complex end-to-end PIM or MDM projects

  • Deep understanding of retail and distribution operating models relating to product and master data management

  • Understanding of processes including new product introduction, vendor onboarding, merchandising, content enrichment, channel publishing and syndication

  • Understand how to create a business requirements document and functional specification for a PIM or MDM solution

  • Experience supporting functional testing and UAT in a hands-on capacity

  • Experience writing training materials and training business users

  • Used Jira, Confluence, Visio, Lucid Charts

  • Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills with diligent attention to detail

  • Proven experience in UML and other process modelling techniques

  • Understand how to estimate Business Analysis effort

 
You also may have...

  • You have played a role on the client-side in product data management, or an associated role in digital product ownership on a transactional website or app

  • You understand the key concepts of data governance and data quality such as accuracy, consistency, completeness

  • Having a view of the wider business processes and systems to build a picture of how new/improved integrations will be received

  • Have used 1 or more PIM or MDM solutions such as Enterworks, Stibo, Riversand, Informatica, Salsify, Sales Layer

 

Our Culture & way of doing things

We have a vibrant, exciting and dynamic work environment on our projects. Our teams are multi-disciplined and relatively self-organising, so you will be used to operating in a flat, collaborative environment. We are highly entrepreneurial and value self-starters and solutions-oriented people.

Pay & Benefits
  • We look for exceptional Permanent and Fixed Term Contract Consultants and our salaries, culture, and benefits reflect that:
  • Competitive salary - between £45,000 - £80,000 depending on experience
  • 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
  • Pension at a 5% matched contribution
  • Private medical coverCareer progression and training opportunities
  • Mac laptop and Apple phone when you start
  • Being part of the Start with Data community - In-person "Summer Party" and "Winter Party", online social events, daily trivia, online wellness events, and virtual coffee 
 
We also offer a chance to join our Talent Network, where you can work as a Contract Consultant (our contracts are OIR35 and there will be an aligned statement of works to your Ltd Company)

 

At this time we are not engaging with recruitment companies. If we ever need to explore other avenues, we have preferred suppliers on standby.

results.title: Executive Assistant to Support High-Functioning CEO
results.description:
Paradigm Life believes in a better financial system. One that makes life more predictable. We help clients create customized financial solutions proven to reduce risk, increase growth, minimize taxes, and put clients in the driver’s seat of their wealth - not Wall Street.

We are looking for an Executive Assistant who knows how to compliment a CEO who hasn’t worked with an assistant in two years. Our CEO knows of the benefits of having a great Executive Assistant, yet he’s never experienced what it’s like to work with an Executive Assistant who anticipates his needs, makes his life easier, and knows how to oversee functions to keep a pulse on the operations so he doesn’t have to.

The Executive Assistant will report to the President of the Company and will support both the CEO and President; with a majority of the time spent with the CEO. When the CEO is kept out of operations, yet still has a pulse on each team and scoreboard and can spend his time being creative within the company, you will know you are successful. You should have a go-getter attitude, experience in an Executive Assistant position, and possess a versatile skillset to ensure the company’s workflow runs smoothly. It’s imperative this candidate be proactive, open to new challenges, meet deadlines, communicate effectively, and serve as a great team player.

Requirements

Persona Defined:

  1. Analyzer: Enjoys finding patterns, identifying problems & creating efficiencies.
  2. Optimizer: Naturally systemizes the predictable and fine tunes optimization.
  3. Influencer: Ability to collaborate and get buy-in that inspires and helps guide stakeholders to drive the business.

 

You will function as the liaison on behalf of the CEO between multiple teams, often driving key initiatives.

Key Job Functions Include, But Are Not Limited To:

  • Meeting Coordination and Support
    • Includes meeting preparation, agenda creation, notes, follow up on tasks and commitments made
  • Ensure Workflows are Running Smoothly and Optimizing Where Needed
  • Client Management
    • Screen and direct phone calls
    • Distribute and reply to correspondence
    • Coordinate client requests
  • Office Resources and Supplies Management
  • Visitor Reception, Management and Hospitality
  • Format, Prepare and Maintain Information for Internal and External Communication – Memos, Emails, Presentations, Reports, Dashboards, etc.
  • Organize Performance Reports
  • Outlook Management for the CEO (Email & Calendar)
  • Event Management
  • Basic Project Management
  • Metrics and Numbers Organization and Preparation:
    • Tableau
    • Smartsheet
    • HubSpot
    • Salesforce
    • Project Status
    • Expense
  • Travel and Accommodation Arrangements (for CEO, President, and Others)
  • Assist inManaging Strategic Plan, Project, and Initiative Alignment with Company Goals and Vision
  • Provide General Administrative Support

Software Platforms Used (Experience Welcomed, But Not Required)

  • Workplace
  • Microsoft Office
  • HubSpot
  • Salesforce
  • Jira
  • Tableau
  • BambooHR

Communication

  • Communication with the CEO will be done using voice/audio memos as his preferred method.
  • Daily 15-minute company-wide standup @ 11am MT. (Zoom and streamed to Workplace).
  • Workplace is used for company-wide announcements and communications.
  • Slack is used within each team.

 

Additional Requirements:

  • Experience as an Executive Assistant (6 years minimum, 12+ years preferred)
  • Comfortable using multiple technologies (tech savvy)
  • Effective remote work experience (3 years minimum)
  • Must be willing to take the Kolbe or Predictive Index Assessment

 

Within this high-functioning system the Company’s rhythm is to operate in three 4-month cycles yearly.

  1. Initiatives
  2. Targets
  3. Projects

 

The team has grown to approximately 70 (including contractors) and each team works independently while not being siloed. Performance measurements are constant and are measured daily using a scoreboard. If you love numbers, tracking KPIs, and hitting goals this is a great role for you.

Benefits

It has taken two years, but the Company culture is in a word - AWESOME! For instance, it’s remote and the hours are based on your location, not the company’s (although there should naturally be some overlap). Everyone on the team is committed to having fun, being client centric, excited about their work, genuinely optimistic, and seeks opportunity.

Our mission first began in 2007 but was fortified during the 2008-2009 Great Recession when we discovered first-hand the value of our principles and strategies. The failure of traditional financial planning methodology was exposed in more ways than one. This discovery was the result of meeting and subsequently helping thousands of individuals and businesses learn about sound wealth strategies and how to ensure that such an occurrence didn't happen again. The Company is a fully developed virtual business which allows our team the opportunity to connect with clients in all 50 states, Canada and US Territories.

If you have a calling to make a difference in people’s lives, this is an exciting opportunity for you. Join and contribute to an innovative team and help us carry out the mission of the Company - to come alongside clients and implement a personalized wealth strategy that empowers them to live a fulfilling life now and ensure the future of their dreams.

 

Salary: $48,000 - $75,000, Depending on Experience.

Bonus: 7-10% of salary

Vacation: 4-6 weeks a year

Medical/Dental/Vision: 40-70% company paid

results.title: COO For eLearning Company
results.description:
Growth Cave is an eLearning company in the online marketing & advertising industry. We teach people how to sell online courses around their knowledge & expertise, using social media ads to get customers. Lucas Lee-Tyson (the CEO) started the business from his college dorm room when he had over $20,000 in student loan and credit card debt. In just 4 short years he has been able to grow the business to over $15M+ per year with 25+ full time employees, who all work remotely. Our reputation is one of the best in the online marketing industry and we are on pace to hit over $50M+ year within the next 2 years.

We are looking for an experienced Chief Operating Officer or COO to oversee, improve, and scale our organization’s ongoing operations and procedures. You will be the company's second-in-command and responsible for the efficiency of business. You'll have to maintain control of diverse business operations, so we expect you to be an experienced and efficient leader.

Starting salary range: $150,000 - $225,000 per year

This is a fully remote position - you will be expected to travel 1-2x per year for team meetups but other than that, you can live/travel wherever you like :)

 

Responsibilities
  • Design and implement business strategies, plans and procedures
  • Set comprehensive goals for performance and growth
  • Oversee daily operations of the company and the work of executives (IT, Marketing, Sales, Finance etc.)
  • Lead employees to encourage maximum performance and dedication
  • Evaluate performance by analyzing and interpreting data and metrics
  • Write and submit reports to the CEO in all matters of importance
  • Manage relationships with partners/vendors

Requirements

  • Proven experience as Chief Operating Office or relevant role
  • Demonstrated excellency in management, follow-through, delivery, focus, project management, and "people stuff"
  • Demonstrable competency in strategic planning and business development
  • Working knowledge of data analysis and performance/operation metrics
  • Outstanding organizational and leadership abilities
  • Aptitude in decision-making and problem-solving

Benefits

  • Training & Development
  • Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
  • Work From Home
  • Wellness Resources

results.title: Business Coordinator
results.description:
About the Company

Headquartered in West Sacramento, Origin Materials is the world's leading carbon negative materials company. Origin’s mission is to enable the world’s transition to sustainable materials. Over the past 10 years, Origin has developed a platform for turning the carbon found in non-food biomass into useful materials, while capturing carbon in the process. Origin’s patented drop-in core technology, economics and carbon impact have been validated by trusted third parties and are supported by a growing list of major global customers and investors. Origin’s first plant, located in Sarnia, Ontario Canada is expected to be operational in 2023 with a second, full-scale commercial plant expected to be operational in 2025 and plans for additional expansion over the next decade. For more information, visit www.originmaterials.com.

Origin Materials believes in protecting its employees and the community and, as such, requires employees who come on site to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Origin provides reasonable accommodations in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

Our People

We believe that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. When you take a job at Origin, you do more than switch companies or advance your career. You become part of the Origin community: an inclusive group of hardworking, uniquely talented people who drive innovation.

Benefits and Perks

You will work with great people. You will be joining a close-knit group of A+ players who like to hustle, create, and work hard because we believe in Origin’s mission: to enable the world’s transition to sustainable materials.

You will make a difference. We’re working on big things, so every person can make make an impact.

You will grow. There are endless opportunities at Origin to learn and improve. You’ll be surrounded by great minds and presented with big challenges. And you and your teammates will support one another in overcoming those challenges.

You will enjoy excellent benefits. We offer a wide range of insurance including Medical and Dental, Vision, Disability, and Life, as well as a 401k, EAP, and generous leave.

You will have flexibility. We don’t believe in one size fits all when it comes to work location and schedule. We care about safety and efficiency so work where and when you are at your best.
